change.item: Encoded in EAD by Conversion and encoding by ArchProteus
Collection level finding aid created by Sheri Sarnoff

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Daniel Hawks was an attorney from Cortland Village, Cortland County, New York. This collection contains letters, financial accounts, deeds, and other legal documents, as well as copies of minutes, calendars, and other court records of the Cortland County Court.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Daniel Hawks was an attorney from Cortland Village, Cortland County, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains letters, financial accounts, deeds, and other legal documents, as well as copies of minutes, calendars, and other court records of the Cortland County Court.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from a dealer in 1968.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Daniel Hawks Papers, 1930-1951. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Hawks Papers).
